SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.server

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.server.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
This class represents the main controller of the game. It manages the game flow and interactions between server and the game model. It follows the Singleton design pattern to ensure only one instance of the controller exists. The controller is responsible for initializing the lobby, adding players, managing game flow, and handling interactions between the server and the game model.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Controller getInstance()
      Gets the instance of the controller.
      Returns:
      The instance of the controller.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the instance of the controller. This method is used to reset the singleton instance of the controller. It can be used when you want to start a new game and need a fresh instance of the controller.

    • initializeLobby

      public void initializeLobby(int nPlayers) throws ClosingLobbyException
      Initializes the lobby with a maximum number of players.
      Parameters:
      nPlayers - The maximum number of players.
      Throws:
      ClosingLobbyException - If the lobby is already closed.

    • start

      public void start()
      Initializes the GameMaster object which manages the game flow. This method is used to create a new GameMaster object with the lobby and the paths to the decks of cards. The actual initialization of the GameMaster is handled by the GameMaster's constructor.

    • tryLoadingGame

      public GameMaster tryLoadingGame() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Tries to load a game from a file.
      Returns:
      The GameMaster object loaded from the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file is not found.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the file is not valid.

    • cancelFile

      public void cancelFile()
      This method is used to delete a saved game file from the file system. It calls the static method `cancelFile` from the `GameMaster` class with the path of the saved game file. The actual deletion of the file is handled by the `GameMaster` class.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String nickname) throws SameNameException, LobbyCompleteException
      Adds a player to the lobby.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      Throws:
      SameNameException - If a player with the same nickname already exists.
      LobbyCompleteException - If the lobby is already full.

    • placeRootCard

      public int placeRootCard(String player, boolean side) throws WrongGamePhaseException, NoTurnException, NoNameException
      Places the root card for a player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player's name.
      side - The side of the card.
      Returns:
      The id of the placed card.
      Throws:
      WrongGamePhaseException - If the game is not in the correct phase.
      NoTurnException - If it's not the player's turn.
      NoNameException - If the field does not exist.

    • chooseObjectiveCard

      public void chooseObjectiveCard(String player, int whichCard) throws WrongGamePhaseException, NoTurnException, NoNameException
      Allows a player to choose an objective card.
      Parameters:
      player - The player's name.
      whichCard - The index of the card to choose.
      Throws:
      WrongGamePhaseException - If the game is not in the correct phase.
      NoTurnException - If it's not the player's turn.
      NoNameException - If the field does not exist.

    • placeCard

      public int placeCard(String player, int indexHand, Point position, boolean side) throws WrongGamePhaseException, NoTurnException, NotEnoughResourcesException, NoNameException, CardPositionException
      Allows a player to place a card.
      Parameters:
      player - The player's name.
      indexHand - The index of the card in the player's hand.
      position - The position to place the card.
      side - The side of the card.
      Returns:
      The id of the placed card.
      Throws:
      WrongGamePhaseException - If the game is not in the correct phase.
      NoTurnException - If it's not the player's turn.
      NotEnoughResourcesException - If the player does not have enough resources.
      NoNameException - If the field does not exist.
      CardPositionException - If the card position is invalid.

    • drawCard

      public int drawCard(String player, boolean gold, int onTableOrDeck) throws WrongGamePhaseException, NoTurnException, NoNameException, CardPositionException
      Allows a player to draw a card.
      Parameters:
      player - The player's name.
      gold - Whether the card is gold or not.
      onTableOrDeck - The index of the card on the table or deck.
      Returns:
      The id of the drawn card.
      Throws:
      WrongGamePhaseException - If the game is not in the correct phase.
      NoTurnException - If it's not the player's turn.
      NoNameException - If the field does not exist.
      CardPositionException - If the card position is invalid.

    • getCommonObjectiveCards

      public Integer[] getCommonObjectiveCards()
      Getter of the common objective cards for the game. This method is used to get the IDs of the common objective cards that are currently in play.
      Returns:
      An array of Integer representing the IDs of the common objective cards.

    • getSecretObjectiveCardsToChoose

      public Integer[] getSecretObjectiveCardsToChoose(String name) throws NoNameException
      Retrieves the secret objective cards for a specific player to choose from. This method is used to get the IDs of the secret objective cards that the specified player can choose from. These cards are individual objectives that only the specific player can aim to achieve.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.
      Returns:
      An array of Integer representing the IDs of the secret objective cards.
      Throws:
      NoNameException - If the player's name does not exist.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves the game state to a file. This implements the game saving advanced functionality.

    • setGameMaster

      public void setGameMaster(GameMaster savedGame)
      Sets the GameMaster for the current game. This method is used when loading a saved game state. It sets the GameMaster to the saved game state and updates the lobby accordingly.
      Parameters:
      savedGame - The saved GameMaster object loaded from a file.
